Simple and easy to use, you'll develop your XPath queries faster with this tool. Can't remember the syntax? No problem, use the Suggest feature to get at least one way to fetch the node you need.

Sample Suggestions

As you know, XPath is a sophisticated query language, and this tool can make sophisticated suggestions. Now you don't need to memorize the syntax! The table below shows output from the app.

Sample XPath Suggestion
 Meaning
/bookstore/book/title This basic query follows your path, it may result in multiple hits if the node has peers
/bookstore[1]/book[2]/title[1] Solves the problem from above, it goes to the second book in your XML
/bookstore/book[title="XPath for Dummies"]/title Find the book whose title is "XPath for Dummies"
/bookstore/book/title[substring(., 11, 7)='Dummies'] Find all the books that have the word 'Dummies' at position 11 in their title
/bookstore/book[price>=9.95]/price Find all the books whose price is greater than 9.95
/bookstore/book/title[@lang='eng'] Find the titles of all books whose language is English (using a tag attribute)
